You could be right.=C2=A0 Though it you could use it for predictions, the e=
xperiment still can be done by asking it what picture I will reveal to this=
 group on Monday, or even what password I will reveal.

Rj


--- On Sat, 7/=
31/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumpt=
ion <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 3

-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, July 31, 2010, 9:48 AM







=C2=A0

=


  


    
      
      
      I really doubt a Ghost Box is capable of re=
mote viewing.
=C2=A0
F-S


On Fri, Jul 30, 2010 at 1:07 PM, rasterer <raste=
rer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




This experiment is intended for those =
interested in exploring the Remote Viewing capabilities of their Ghost Box'=
s, EVP recorders. or even personal clairvoyant or precognitive capabilities=
 And to maybe even have a little fun here.


On Friday, 7/30/2010 I placed =
an object on top of my computer monitor, right in front of me, and will lea=
ve it there until noon Denver time on Monday, 8/2/2010. This experiment ask=
s for participants to determine what that object is. Vague or partial answe=
rs won't be counted (for example, just giving a color, shape, size, what it=
's made of, etc): we're looking for what it is. Answers anyone reveals afte=
r noon Denver time Monday won't count. Participants can use their ghost box=
es, EVP recorders, or any other means they chose. At the end of the experim=
ent, I will reveal the object, and a tally of the number of correct and/or =
incorrect answers.


In order to keep me honest, I have taken a picture of =
the object at the start of the experiment and loaded it to the Files sectio=
n (RJ folder) of this group. The idea with this file is that you can downlo=
ad it now and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then at the end of the exper=
iment, I will post the password so you can reveal the contents of the file.=
 That way, you were in control of the original image during the entire test=
, not me. 


Password pdf: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/fi=
les/ RJ/RJ20100730. pdf

And if you do not care to download the pdf file no=
w, I will post the final image there at the end of the experiment anyway.

=

My monitor is one of the older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" an=
d "Multiscan 200sf" on the upper front. I have a couple monitors stacked in=
 my closet too: they are not the monitors used in this experiment (they are=
 not plugged in, and have nothing else on them anyway), and I have several =
laptops around: they are also not the monitors in this experiment. The moni=
tor in this experiment is the only SONY monitor I have, says "SONY in vario=
us places on it, and can be seen in the following link from the first exper=
iment, when the correct answer would have been "radio":


http://tech. grou=
ps.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 1.JPG

Please post all =
answers to the group thread: that way, there will be a public record and I =
won't get accused of losing any answers. Any answers sent directly to me, I=
 will repost on the public thread.







    
     

    
    


 



  

=
